summary: Honestly, I'm ageing like… I’m a Pokémon, just gaining experience and levelling up. Literally any version of myself from a...
text: Honestly, I'm ageing like… I’m a Pokémon, just gaining experience and levelling up. Literally any version of myself from a previous moment in time is just such a steep decline. It’s crazy and I guess that’s a good thing.
source:
@danielhowell during his live show on the 9th of October 2018

summary: “Do you not feel bad, not uploading videos regularly?” Em… no. I mean the thing is it’s like about being a creator versus being...
text: “Do you not feel bad, not uploading videos regularly?” Em… no. I mean the thing is it’s like about being a creator versus being a YouTuber. You know what I mean? It’s like is my life’s purpose as an entertainer, which I guess is what I am - no matter what the platform or the format, I am making content, it doesn't matter if it’s a YouTube video or a live performance or a radio show or just Twitter content or a terrible meme on tumblr - the purpose of my life, I’m a male entertainer. Yeah. There we go. I’m a male entertainer. *chuckles*. Yeah, that does sound horrific but I guess it’s accurate. You know, is it the like what I guess what I’m saying is that as long as I’m making content, even if it’s not on YouTube, ‘cause the thing with YouTube there’s an algorithm and there’s a game and it’s all about certain kinds of creativity, so it’s not a rush. I think the one thing we’ve established since 2009 is that I’m not in a rush, you know what I mean? I’ll make the YouTube videos when I feel like I’ve got something to say. So I’m not worried about trying to be the most popular YouTuber all the time. It’s just about making the Good Content and knowing that you’ll always be there to consume it. Because you’re a bunch of nerds *said fondly*.
source:
@danielhowell during his live show on the 9th of October 2018

Quotes from Dan (130/?)

Dan on his dinof upload schedule and how he views himself as content creator.

blog.description: Nina, she/her, 24, Denmark. Always writing. My fics. About me

summary: It’s been a year since I started to support the charity YoungMinds, which has personally been one of my favourite things that I...
text: It’s been a year since I started to support the charity YoungMinds, which has personally been one of my favourite things that I have ever done. I mean this is what I’m talking about, right? Like, videos on my channel and being creative, I feel like the Daniel and Depression video when I think about my life, like if I died tomorrow, what would I have been like: I’m happy, like this made me happy that I did this thing. It was that. You know what I man? Probably the most. And YoungMinds their whole thing this year, it’s their 25th anniversary and when they raise money for stuff it goes directly into pressuring the government to make more services for young people’s mental health issues or creating really amazing short films that things or whatever and it's just really good. And I was thinking, basically, you know when we were on tour we had a lot of talking to you guys, seeing a lot of you and one thing when people were talking to me about videos that meant a lot to them, they were talking about Daniel and Depression video, obviously, they were talking about videos that were really fun but a lot of people were saying, going all the way back, to the Existential crisis video and The meaning of life video that probably my best quote when I said: Embrace the void and have the courage to exist. Which is funny because I have a hard time being sincere because I’m scared of all the cynicism in the world and for me it’s like showing vulnerability to be sincere and just I’m scared. But if we’re being real, it’s not a soppy quote, it's very real. You know what I mean? Going back to what that video was talking about, it's saying like: If there is no meaning to life because there are no big answers out there in the universe and therefore everything is pointless, then you get to define your own existence. And whatever brings you happiness that’s your defining your own meaning and that’s some real shit right there. You know what I mean? Ever since basically 2013, I was like there should be something Dan merch that has this quote, because that would be good right? But the time never came and then obviously I finally did Dan shop like four years later, this year or whatever, and then we went on tour. And then all these people were like: I have it tattooed on my arm; I’ve written it somewhere on my wall and it’s a really good thing. And I was like, you know what? This is really good. So I’ve decided for tomorrow, for World Mental Health Day, I am going to be releasing some new Dan merch, which says HAVE THE COURAGE TO EXIST and all of the proceeds will go to YoungMinds, which I feel like is a really good idea.
source:
@danielhowell during his live show on the 9th of October 2018

Quotes from Dan (129/?)

Tomorrow (10/10), probably around 8 PM UK time, there will be new HAVE THE COUAGE TO EXIST at shop.danielhowell.com and all proceeds will go to YoungMinds. Support it if you can.

tags: i missed him so so much i cried but i got him back and I am gonna fite anyone ruining this for me
summary: In conclusion: I love Dan.

reblog.comment: In conclusion: I love Dan.

summary:
i feel like i just got everything i love his live shows for, like:
life updates, stories about him and his family, the dog, his...
body:
i feel like i just got everything i love his live shows for, like:

life updates, stories about him and his family, the dog, his thoughts on things, music recommendations, his happy smile, cute laughter, PAINTED NAILS (sorry), future plans kind of, the reassurance and comfort that he gives us and that i missed so much you can’t imagine (like i’m literally shaking right now), his excitement about the ii movie, his sarcasm and also softness and cuteness, have i mentioned his laugh?! yeah, the way he goes deep but then starts laughing to relieve the tension,..

i can go on and on tbh and i can’t believe i survived those 5 months without this kind of recharge
